issues.description: The UML in the problem statement declares the Lecture attributes as private (leading '-' in the UML) while the template file pre-declares two attributes as public (lectureName and numberOfInscribedStudents). The solution uses private attributes for all fields. This visibility difference between the UML/problem statement and the template can confuse students about the intended visibility (should they leave or add public fields, or make them private and provide getters/setters?).
issues.suggested_fix: Make the template's pre-declared attributes private to match the UML and the solution. Specifically, change 'public String lectureName;' and 'public int numberOfInscribedStudents;' to 'private' in template_repository/src/de/tum/cit/ase/Lecture.java. This aligns the template with the UML (private attributes) and the solution, avoiding confusion about whether students should expose fields or use getters/setters.
